It is the 23rd of July 2014. The date on the first page states 31 July 2014.

Challenge Rules.

1) There will be PUBLIC poll-voting. After challenge close 31-July-2014. Only participants are allow to vote. And you can NOT vote for yourself.

23 - 31 = 8.

It is the 23rd of July 2014. The date on the first page states 31 July 2014.

23 - 31 = 8.

My mistake. It should be until 31-August-2014.

Well, my place already 24th of 2014 (+8 GMT).

My mistake. It should be until 31-August-2014.

Well, my place already 24th of 2014 (+8 GMT).

I figured it was a minor oversight, it happens to the best of us.

Anyway, I am progressing nicely on getting my SSTO program back up and running after .24. Finally got most of my mods working again, but my core one is not up yet. But I have a far more functional SSTO than I ever imagined for just simple science gathering missions. And it is a joy to fly, actually lands at 170mph as opposed to some of my other craft which land at over 200.

Looking like a interesting comp so far from whates been submitted so far will be a hard choice for voting

Reach orbit with tonnes to spare

To rescue kerbals

What do you mean cant see I can see it. turn up the brightness on your moniter

Besides if you dont believe ... download and try for yourself.

This thing fly's so easy anyone can make orbit with fuel to spare and I'm yet to get a spin-out with it

and I've made over 6 rescue's and 4 trips to my station and back since I started 0.24

The only issue I have with this craft is that the radial air intakes are a little closer to the docking port then I'd like but it was orginally made for use without the ram intakes and only the standard jet engine, which also made orbit !!!.

Oh and No part Alt F12 used in its construction or flight either so no part clipping just good old fashioned STOCK build techniques. Cause thats how I role... These days

Edit ;

Ive been playing with this little desgin and wanted to add a few pics of the results. It is balanced well enough to to handle nuke rockets and makes orbit still with ease enabling it to reach mun even with the extra cockpit or science equipment attached. Also part count is 55 Mass is ... I dont know as I dont have redux or mechjeb

needed to add my 2cents

I have to admit, it was really hard to choose a winner. In my catalogue, that is.

After BSC I think the primary judging criterea are "cool sci-fi looks". It came down to either the Hawk(military SSTO) or the Robin. The Robin won! So, here it is.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I am going to break the rules in relation to a few cosmetic things such as keeping the engines all in a single stage, putting ascent profile in the description and action group explainations. Why? I want to visually see my action groups, I don't like to tell others how to play the game and if you're too lazy to familiarise yourself with craft action groups in the action groups interface prior to take off then, please don't fly my craft. Simple as that. They've had too much design time and expertise put into them for lazy pilots to appreciate. Ouch!

What can I say? I've got heavy lifters and massive delta-v SSTOs. However, I get the most joy out of my smaller craft and this is one of the most fun to fly. Extreme maneuverability with SAS-free flying, all perfectly balanced without any hidden flight surfaces. She's not a working craft, 100% pure funzies.

Download: Robin v1.0

Samething, well you can see my argument in the FAR thread over that nerf. But I have since redesigned one craft, and haven't got around to doing others yet. Waiting on a few other mods to update to fix some issues.

Skathi

A light-duty, family-friendly SSTO spaceplane: 4 passengers and a 4.5 ton cargo.

Highlights

  • Enjoy gentle flight from take off (no pitch up required) to touch down (55 m/s).
  • Fully fueled by your dealer with a generous 200 m/s ÃŽâ€v margin for error.
  • Climb at 50% throttle Ã¢â‚¬â€œ no more Aerodynamic Failures!
  • Demonstration payload, a Minmus lander included at no extra charge!

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Specifications

Mass: 13 tons

Passengers: 4 Kerbals (must be friendly)

Rated payload capacity: 4.5 tons

Maneuver dV after 100 km orbital insertion: 200 m/s

Requires SP+ and FAR or NEAR. Supports DRE.

Recommended additional plugins: TAC Fuel Balancer, Kerbal Flight Data, NavUtilities

How much, you ask? Surely she's more than Ã¢Ë†Å¡100,000!

No, not at all, my friend. Skathi can be yours today for the low, low price of just Ã¢Ë†Å¡36,379.1!*

Buy Skathi at your local dealer today!

Full flight instructions are included below with general guidelines in the craft description.

Action groups

1: Toggle RAPIER mode

6: Increase canard flap deflection

7: Decrease canard flap deflection

8: Increase collective flap deflection

9: Decrease collective flap deflection

0: Toggle RAPIER and OMS

Pre-flight

  1. Lock brakes
  2. Cut throttle
  3. Check control surface deflections
  4. Check flap deflections
  5. Stage to activate RAPIERs
  6. Check RAPIER mode toggle
  7. Check OMS
  8. Reenable automatic RAPIER mode toggle
  9. Enable DCA
  10. Set DCA scaling speed to 200 m/s???
  11. Set AoA limiter to Ã‚Â±20Ã‚Â°
  12. Enable yaw damper
  13. Check cargo bay for stowaways#

Launch

  1. Confirm RAPIERs active
  2. Set flaps to position 3
  3. Set throttle to maximum
  4. Release brakes
  5. At 110 m/s, pitch up < 5Ã‚Â°
  6. Take off at 120 m/s
  7. Decrease flap deflection to 0
  8. Reduce throttle to 50%
  9. Maintain pitch of 15Ã‚Â° and speed < Mach 0.8
  10. Climb to 5 km

Transsonic to Climb

Preconditions

  • Altitude 5 km
  • Speed Mach 0.8Ã¢â‚¬â€œ0.9

  1. Set canard flap deflection to 1
  2. Increase throttle to 100%
  3. Maintain pitch of 10Ã‚Â°Ã¢â‚¬â€œ15Ã‚Â°
  4. Climb to 6Ã¢â‚¬â€œ8 km, speed Mach 1.2
  5. Decrease throttle to 50%
  6. Increase canard flap deflection to 2
  7. Check fuel balance Ã¢â‚¬â€œ maintain LF/OX balance between forward and rear tanks
  8. Climb to 15 km

Run

Preconditions

  • Altitude > 15 km
  • Speed > Mach 2

  1. Maintain pitch of 10Ã‚Â°Ã¢â‚¬â€œ15Ã‚Â°
  2. Increase throttle to 75%
  3. Climb to 20 km
  4. Maintain pitch of 5Ã‚Â°Ã¢â‚¬â€œ10Ã‚Â° and AoA < 10Ã‚Â°
  5. Hold altitude until speed > Mach 4
  6. Increase throttle 100%
  7. Climb to 25 km and Mach 5

Suborbital to Orbital Insertion

Preconditions

  • Altitude 25 km
  • Speed Mach 5
  • Vertical climb less than 10 m/s

  1. Pitch up to 15Ã‚Â°
  2. Switch RAPIERs to closed cycle
  3. Gradually pitch down to 0Ã‚Â° AoA as time to AP exceeds 1:00
  4. Cut throttle when AP exceeds 100 km
  5. Maintain prograde heading
  6. When altitude > 65 km, open cargo bay doors, extend solar panels
  7. Swap RAPIERs and OMS
  8. Engage OMS at AP for circularization

Deorbit and Aerobraking

  1. Burn retrograde until PE is 30 km, 30Ã‚Â° E of KSC
  2. Maintain AoA of 85Ã‚Â°Ã¢â‚¬â€œ90Ã‚Â° from 70Ã¢â‚¬â€œ55 km altitude
  3. Decrease AoA to 45Ã‚Â° by 45 km altitude
  4. Decrease AoA to 20Ã‚Â°Ã¢â‚¬â€œ30Ã‚Â° by 20 km altitude
  5. Lower pitch to increase glide range as needed
  6. At 100 km from KSC choose runway 09 or 27 based on altitude

Approach and Landing

  • Glideslope at 8 tons is 5Ã‚Â°
  • Requires southward jog around mountains, or overflying KSC

  1. Targets (distance, altitude, speed):


    2. Touch down at 50Ã¢â‚¬â€œ60 m/s
    3. Set flaps to 0
    4. Apply brakes


      #Very important, or you will not go to space today

      Skathi with demonstrated payload (must read flight instructions)

  3. 20 km, 2.2 km, 100 m/s
  4. 15 km, 1.5 km, 90 m/s
  5. 10 km, 1 km, 80 m/s - set flaps to 2
  6. 2 km, 250 m, 60 m/s

what are you trying to sell here ;-D

Iolite Mk1 forward-swept versatility spaceplane.

The Mk2 and Mk3 versions sacrifice performance to gain STOL and VTOL capability.

Maximum turbojet speed: 2,260 m/s

Mass (take-off): 46 tonnes

Dry mass: 22 tonnes

Parts: 165 (39 struts)

Atmospheric powerplant: 4* turbojets

Vacuum powerplant: 2* LV-N

Size: medium, no idea dimensions

Armament: none

Payload is variable and you can put whatever you want in the cargo bay. This is long-range passenger ferry configuration with an extra fuel tank and 6 economy class seats in the cargo bay. It possesses 4 first class seats in the cabin and is operated by 2 crew members.

Take off at >115 m/s at ~ 10 degree pitch

Keep an eye out on the intake air and throttle down to ensure the ratio does not exceed 1:10.

Orbital insertion complete. Not my best piloting this time. Looks like I forgot to ditch the TAC-LS stuff since it isn't on for this sandbox savegame, and I have way too much oxidiser for Laythe.

Presenting the Airbus Kerbin.

Escape Velocity's premiere "liesure-liner" spaceplane, the Airbus Kerbin takes passengers into low-Kerbin orbit. Seats 24 passengers plus the pilot.

Action Groups:

1 - Solar Arrays

3 - Ladders

0 - Switch Modes

Ascent Profile: At full throttle, reach the end of the runway and pull up sharply (but not too sharply!). Gradually tilt up to 75 degrees, and hold until ~7000m. Begin tilting downwards so as to reach 45 degrees at 10,000m. Continue to gradually tilt down as you go, aiming for a stable 15- to 20-degree tilt by 20,000m. Maintain altitude between 20,000 and 22,000m while attaining a speed of 1,400m/s minimum. Once up to speed, switch modes with 0 and point towards 45 degrees, cutting throttle back to 75% to prevent engines from exploding. Raise apoapsis to 75km, then tilt to 0 degrees and keep apoapsis around 70,500m minimum as necessary. Circularize at apoapsis.

Be sure to save a small amount of fuel for landing (50 liquid fuel recommended).

Post-orbital insertion.

And the return landing.

Edited August 2, 2014 by SkyRender
10 entry so far. 1st post updated with link.

Hi fellow Kerbonauts, I take this challenge on with my S2-5M SSTO spaceplane (a cool name, for sure).

I've used the B9 Aerospace mod, because it's a great mod for spaceplanes and because whenever I build a spaceplane with stock parts only, it always ends up looking like a '80s Volvo : sturdy but inelegant (to say the least).

She's powered by 5 Sabre M and 4 LV-N which give her plenty of thrust and endurance. The CoM is right in the middle of the payload bay, so the payload weight won't shift the CoM. The CoL is just behind the CoM for good maneuvrability and to avoid a nose or tail heavy ship. Keep it that way by transfering fuel between fuel tanks while in atmospheric flight (TaC Fuel Balancer is recommended).

Action groups

---------------

1. Toggle Sabre engines

2. Switch Sabre engines mode (air / vac)

3. Toggle air intakes

0. Toggle LV-N engines

Ascent profile (Kerbin, w/o payload)

----------------------------------------

1. Takeoff : 100 m/s.

2. Ascent : 0 - 6 km @ 90Ã‚Â°, 6 - 12 km @ 60Ã‚Â°, 12 - 18 km @ 40Ã‚Â°, 18 - 24 km @ 20Ã‚Â°, 24 - 30 km @ 10Ã‚Â°.

3. Keep altitude around 30 - 31 km until speed > 1700 m/s (surf).

4. Switch Sabres to vac mode, activate LV-Ns and pull to 30Ã‚Â° angle.

5. When apoapsis > 60 km, shutdown Sabres and go prograde.

6. When apoapsis > 70 km, shutdown LV-Ns.

7. Wait for apoapsis, circularize.

Ship specifications

---------------------

Mod used : B9 Aerospace

Parts count : 200

Dry / wet mass : 83 / 158 tons

Payload capacity : 54 tons

Crew capacity : 4

Sabres max thrust : ~400 tons

LV-Ns max thrust : 24 tons

Atm / vac dV : 54000 m/s / 4900 m/s

Takeoff speed : 100 m/s

Landing speed : 60 m/s

Electric charge : 800 units + 4 RTG

There are 201 parts in the ship presented in the album because of the Mechjeb module used to show telemetry. Mechjeb module, rover and merry-go-round are not included in craft file.

Download craft file --> here <--

Updated 1st post with the entries photo. Please let me know if you would like your craft poster change.

I have a few entries I could enter, I don't know if multiple entries are allowed but here's one I'm rather proud of. It doesn't have much practical game purposes aside from the kerbal rescue missions as it does have a B9 two seater cockpit

SF-38 Silvershadow MKIII

Yes there was a MK II and a Mk I before it which are not being entered. This is the next generation in the ASF (Advanced Star Fighter) program. This craft is designed to be light, agile, sustain itself under extreme maneuvers and have a small internal weapons (cargo) bay a 2m one to be exact. This version of the Silvershadow (craft file will be included in this post at a later time) is the export model where I changed the description for the rules and removed my B9 sensor package to reduce cost. The KRAF, Kerbal Royal Air Force, actually requested that for the export model the advanced sensor package should not be included per military contract obligations . Anyway this craft does use a fair amount of mods.

MOD LIST:

Tac life support v 9

B9

Procedural wings

Flys with FAR and Deadly Re-entry

KW Rocketry fuel tanks and batteries

Mech Jeb

And I want to say that is it as I'm not 100%. It may require Kerbonov and Firespitter but I don't think I put any parts from those mods on this this rocket fighter though I do have them on my install.

Technical data:

Cost: 53,852

Part Count: 78

Weight loaded: 20.57t

Dry weight: 11.89T

Crew Capacity: 2

SABRE engine max thrust: In atmosphere about 360 nm I believe with FAR enabled, I am not sure in a vacuum I would guess around 430 nm

Mono propellant engines max thrust: 40 nm in vacuum

Take off Speed: around 120 ms

Landing speed: around 70 to 90ms

Payload: Light as there is only a 2 m cargo bay! Load it up with sepatrons in its weapons system and fire away

Max ceiling in stable orbit without refueling: A bit over 600km

Action groups

1 SABRE engines toggle on off

2 SABRE engines switch mode and close intakes

3 Mono propellant engines toggle on off

4 increase flap deflection

5 decrease flap deflection

6 air brakes

7 cargo

there are also parachutes if you need them to slow down on re-entry available through staging on the second stage

Take off procedure

1. Verify funcitonality of all control surfaces and press t to turn on SAS

2. press 5 to retract flaps one setting

3. press 1 to fire engines

4. start pitching up around 70 to 80ms per second, take off speed is between 110 ms and 120 ms.

5. once air borne press 5 to fully retract flaps and g to retract landing gear

6. maintian an angle of attack of 45 to 70 degrees until you reach 16k to 18k

7. keep an eye on intake air supply as you make yuour way into orbit, it should run out of air at 31.5k approximately. You want to stay in air breathing mode until about 1700 ms or just over which is the peak speed in airbreathing. When that happens, press 2 to swich SABER engines to closed cycle.

Again, working on the best way to host it for download so check back for the download link but I have plenty of photos!

Full Album http://imgur.com/a/KrMTJ#0

Other notes:

The craft was created out of trial and error. The original Silvershadow used RAPIER engines with no canards with the same tri vertical stabilizer setup. It had issues at low speeds though and maneuverability problems as it's delta wings where swept into the middle. The MKII looks exactly like the MKIII except it has RAPIER engines and KSP interstellar precoolers. This craft, even fully loaded with the newest version of FAR, can do barrel rolls, loopdy loops, cobra rolls, etc. It can fly straight vertical in the atmosphere under full throttle up to about 17km or so. It's VERY powerful! Not the cheapest for what it is but you get what you pay for! A high preforming multimode starfighter!

https://www.dropbox.com/s/1ovxedsy5mkkkt9/SF-39%20Silvershadow%20Mk%20III%20Export.craft
